channel.title: Endangered Species on ZooBerry
channel.description: Recent content in Endangered Species on ZooBerry

item.title: Red Ruffed Lemur
item.description: The red ruffed lemur is one of the largest primates of Madagascar, with thick red and black fur.

item.title: Rhea
item.description: A large, flightless bird of South America with new skin, sound, and enrichment.

item.title: White-Flippered Penguin
item.description: One of the smallest penguin species alive today, with two variant skins.

item.title: African Butterfly
item.description: An ambient African Sangrias butterfly. She is the only blood-red butterfly in the world and lives in the Savannah, Desert and Grassland. Requires ES to work.

item.title: African Golden Cat
item.description: A medium-sized cat with polymorphic coat colors found in tropical rainforests.

item.title: Ambient Peafowl
item.description: An ambient peafowl that randomly appears in your zoo.

item.title: Ambient Sheep
item.description: An ambient sheep that randomly appears and moves through obstructions in your zoo.

item.title: Blue Jay
item.description: A blue jay that flies over your zoo, commonly found in boreal and temperate forests.

item.title: Cairns Birdwing Butterfly
item.description: Australia’s largest butterfly, commonly seen in rainforests and suburban areas.

item.title: Cardinal
item.description: A cardinal that flies over your zoo, commonly found in North America.

item.title: Coyote
item.description: A smaller relative of the wolf, the adaptable coyote thrives in all biomes.

item.title: Eclectus Parrot
item.description: A bird that flies over your zoo. Parrots are brightly colored birds, with males and females displaying distinct plumage.

item.title: Egyptian Vulture
item.description: A scavenging bird that flies over your zoo, famous for using stones to break eggs.

item.title: Fenris Wolf
item.description: Fenrirâ€™s descendants are larger than normal wolves and feature multiple skins.

item.title: Fishing Cat
item.description: Fishing cats are solitary and found in a variety of watery habitats. Includes skins, icons, and sound files.

item.title: Klipspringer
item.description: An antelope that bounds from rock to rock.

item.title: Norwegian Fjord Pony
item.description: A domesticated pony, one of the oldest horse breeds known to mankind.

item.title: Peacock Butterfly
item.description: A butterfly that appears randomly in your zoo, commonly found in grasslands and forests.

item.title: Rainbow Lorikeet
item.description: A bird that flies over your zoo. Rainbow lorikeets are active, noisy, and gregarious birds.

item.title: Rice Paper Butterfly
item.description: A butterfly that appears randomly in your zoo, often seen in forests and grasslands.

item.title: Sun Conure
item.description: Golden-feathered birds with green wing tips, Sun Conures are playful and colorful.

item.title: Yellow Clouded Sulphur Butterfly
item.description: A butterfly that appears randomly in your zoo, found worldwide.

item.title: Boer Goat
item.description: Boer Goat is an animal for Zoo Tycoon 2 created by Slice.

item.title: Black-Backed Jackal
item.description: These animals are omnivorous and will eat carrion, as well as plants such as grass, fruit, berries and seed.

item.title: Dhole II
item.description: The dhole is a species of canid native to Southeast Asia. It is the only extant member of the genus Cuon.

item.title: Maned Wolf
item.description: A South American savannah-dwelling canid with one variant skin.

item.title: Red-Footed Tortoise
item.description: Also known as the South American red-footed tortoise, the males grow up to 13.5 inches (30.4 cm) and are somewhat larger than females.

item.title: Ornate Box Turtle
item.description: The ornate box turtle is one of two turtle species on the Great Plains that are terrestrial.

item.title: Blue Poison Dart Frog
item.description: These little frogs are easily recognized by their blue color, which is generally darker on the limbs and belly and overlaid with black spots or patches.

item.title: Cassowary
item.description: Cassowaries are very large flightless birds native to the tropical forests of New Guinea and northeastern Australia.

item.title: Red Eyed Tree Frog
item.description: A vibrant tree frog native to Central and South America, known for its bright red eyes.

item.title: Strawberry Dart Frog
item.description: The strawberry poison dart frog is common in the Atlantic lowland tropical forests of Central America.

item.title: Wisent
item.description: This ungulate is also known as the European bison. Some authors consider it and the American bison to be conspecific.

item.title: Bat Eared Fox
item.description: These foxes live in the scrub, savannah and grasslands of Africa.

item.title: Bornean Pygmy Elephant
item.description: Borneo pygmy elephants have significantly different characteristics from their cousins found on mainland Asia and Sumatra.

item.title: Chacoan Peccary
item.description: The Chacoan peccary’s bristly coat is a speckled charcoal or brownish-grey, interspersed with long guard hairs.

item.title: Common Dolphin
item.description: Common dolphins can be found throughout the Atlantic and Pacific Oceans.

item.title: Crocodile Monitor
item.description: Generally arboreal, or tree dwelling. Crocodile monitors inhabit rainforests and adjacent savannas.

item.title: Yacare Caiman
item.description: The yacare caiman is found in a variety of habitat types, often associated with floating mats of vegetation.

item.title: Domesticated Silver Fox (Siberian Fox)
item.description: A domesticated form of the silver morph of the red fox.

item.title: Fringe Eared Oryx
item.description: The Fringe-Eared Oryx is a scrub dwelling antelope. It is a subspecies of gemsbok native to southern Africa.

item.title: Dall Sheep
item.description: First animal Ive ever made

item.title: Dhole
item.description: Resized bigger than the wolf
